thread.title: Liverpool's Emre Can preparing for a 'big fight' with Everton in April Merseyside Derby
thread.title_full: Liverpool's Emre Can preparing for a 'big fight' with Everton in April Merseyside Derby

author: Arash Hekmat
title: Liverpool's Emre Can preparing for a 'big fight' with Everton in April Merseyside Derby
text:
Liverpool's Emre Can preparing for a 'big fight' with Everton in April Merseyside Derby The Germany international is expecting another fiery encounter Share Can is expecting an 'interesting' game when Everton visit Anfield (Photo: Reuters / Phil Noble) Share Get Liverpool FC   
That tantalising prospect is what Reds and Toffees fans have to look forward to after the latest international break, writes James Pearce for the Liverpool Echo . 
And the Germany international, in the squad for Wednesday's friendly with England, believes that Liverpool will carry their momentum from Sunday's 1-1 draw with Manchester City into the derby. 
“It’s another big, big game, and of course we want to win,” Can said. In 2015, the Germany international was in the thick of it (Photo: Magi Haroun/REX) He clashed with Brendan Galloway and Ross Barkley (Photo: AFP/Getty) Read More Emre Can and Jurgen Klopp are in agreement that the Liverpool midfielder should stay at Anfield 
“It’s a special game for Liverpool, for the supporters, for us, and it will be a big, big fight. 
“Everton have done well in the last few games but we have done good as well. It will be an interesting game.” 
Can, who was outstanding in midfield for the Reds, believes a share of the spoils was about right. 
“It was an open game and both sides had big chances, so I think nobody can complain about 1-1,” he added. 
“Man City had chances at the end but we had a big chance as well so I think 1-1 was okay. Emre Can clashes with Ross Barkley (Photo: Action Images via Reuters / Lee Smith) 
Liverpool fan Mike Myers delights supporters as he joins them to watch Manchester City game in New York 
“Every game is always intense but today maybe it was a little bit more intense because Man City are a team who want to play and they did it very well. 
“If you play in front of the back four then you have to run a lot. I tried to help my team. It was an intense game.” 
Can reserved special praise for James Milner, who opened the scoring by dispatching his seventh penalty of the season. 
“I have never seen a player like Millie who scores penalties,” he told Liverpoolfc.com. 
“He’s incredible in training sessions - every ball is hard in the corner, he shoots penalties very well. 
“In the game he played very well, and it wasn’t an easy game for him against Raheem (Sterling). He’s quick and very difficult to play against. I’m very happy that he scored again.” Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
